name: extemporal
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
done or said without any preparation or thought: The extemporal comedy of the clown has always been unscripted. She gave an extemporal epitaph on the death of her uncle. Synonyms
extemporaneous
extempore
More examplesFewer examplesThese extemporal verses were written after a visit to the coast.He was a performer with a pleasant, extemporal wit.She has a gift for extemporal comedy.In those days, extemporal acting was always part of performing a play.He believed his extemporal and spontaneous style of writing to be the ideal.
